title: Use Log Rules
speech: Logarithm multiplication rule:  the log base a of b, plus the log base a of c is equal to the log base a of b c, , so  the log base 3 of x plus the log base 3 of, parentheses x minus 8,  is equal to the log base 3 of parentheses, x, parentheses x minus 8,

title: Rewrite the Expression
text: $$2=\log_{3}\left(9\right)$$, so we can rewrite it as $$\log_{3}\left(9\right)=\log_{3}\left(x \left(x-8\right)\right)$$
speech: 2 is equal to the log base 3 of 9, , so we can rewrite it as  the log base 3 of 9 is equal to the log base 3 of parentheses, x, parentheses x minus 8,
pacedSpeech: 2 is equal to the log base 3 of 9,
, so we can rewrite it as   the log base 3 of 9 is equal to the log base 3 of , x,  x minus 8,

title: Matching bases
text: With all term containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes $$x \left(x-8\right)=9$$.
speech: With all term containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes  x, parentheses x minus 8,  is equal to 9 .
pacedSpeech: With all term containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes   x,  x minus 8,  is equal to 9

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: Given $$x \left(x-8\right)=9$$ we can solve for $$x$$. $$x \left(x-8\right)=9$$ can be simplified into $$x^2-8x-9=0$$. We can factor $$x^2-8x-9$$ as $$\left(x-9\right) \left(x+1\right)$$. $$\left(x-9\right) \left(x+1\right)=0$$ has two solutions which are $$x=-1$$ and $$x=9$$. Given $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$, $$b$$ can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer. Therefore $$x=9$$ is the only solution for this equation.
